words.definition: When a bad thing is acute, it is very severe and intense.
words.example: When she fell out of the tree, the girl felt an acute pain in her arm.

words.definition: Aggression is behavior that is mean or violent to others.
words.example: The problem was only made worse by Mark’s aggression.

words.definition: A banquet is a grand formal dinner.
words.example: Both families brought a lot of food for the wedding banquet.

words.definition: A biography is an account of someone’s life that is written by someone else.
words.example: We read a biography about Charles Darwin in science class.

words.definition: To boost something means to increase or improve it.
words.example: Lowering prices boosts customers’ interest in shopping.

words.definition: To clap means to hit one’s hands together to express pleasure or get attention.
words.example: After the speech, everyone in the crowd clapped their hands for the speaker.

words.definition: To compel someone to do something means to force them to do it.
words.example: Traffic signs compel drivers to drive safely.

words.definition: The dominance of a person is their state of being more powerful than others.
words.example: Large gorillas hit their chests to express their dominance.

words.definition: When something is gorgeous, it is very pleasing and attractive.
words.example: The girl felt like a princess in her gorgeous new dress.

words.definition: When something is inevitable, it is certain to happen or cannot be avoided.
words.example: It is inevitable that the sun will rise tomorrow.

words.definition: A legacy is something that someone has achieved in their life or that will continue to exist after they die.
words.example: The king left a legacy of peace and happiness for his people.

words.definition: A masterpiece is a very good painting, novel, movie, or other work of art.
words.example: The 'Mona Lisa' is a world-famous masterpiece.

words.definition: If there are multiple things, there are many of them.
words.example: The student had multiple reasons for being late to class.

words.definition: To narrate a story means to write or say it.
words.example: The teacher narrated a story about a dragon to the class.

words.definition: When something is notorious, it is well-known because of something bad.
words.example: The pirate was notorious for stealing from every ship he saw.

words.definition: When something is outdated, it is old and no longer useful in modern times.
words.example: The computer was so outdated that it couldn't run any new programs.

words.definition: Overall means when everything is considered.
words.example: Overall, the party was a success even though it rained.

words.definition: A partiality is a tendency to prefer one person or thing over another.
words.example: The teacher showed partiality towards the students who studied hard.

words.definition: When something is spontaneous, it happens suddenly and without planning.
words.example: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer when the goal was scored.

words.definition: A virtue is a good quality or way of behaving.
words.example: Patience is a virtue that helps people through hard times.
